page.title: 01Hills around Langdale End
page.content: Varied scenery of steep sided flat topped hills. The valleys have a mixture of farms and the upper slopes of the hills are generally coverd in confiers with some deciduous woodland in the valleys. Often the tops of the hills are almost flat and formed, which is unseen from the valleys. Becauseof the variety of landscape and the hills, the scenery is very pleasant and thus much visited by tourists. There are a couple of minor roads for day trips and several footpaths for walkers. Thre are a scattering of forms and two small villages. Langdale End and Broxa which are both predominantly farming communities. Most residents appear to be involved in farming.
